articles.description: Bayern Munich and Tottenham agree a deal in principle for England striker Harry Kane worth more than 100m euros (£86.4m).
articles.title: Tottenham & Bayern agree deal in principle for Kane

articles.description: Transfer updates and countdown to the start of the Premier League season, with managers facing the media in their first news conferences of the season.
articles.title: Latest transfer news and Premier League build-up

articles.description: Watch live coverage from the eighth day of the 2023 Cycling World Championships in Glasgow.
articles.title: Watch: 2023 Cycling World Championships

articles.description: We ask 26 BBC pundits to predict who will win the Premier League title, who will finish in the top four and who might break into the top six.
articles.title: Premier League predictions: Who will be champions?

articles.description: Listen to commentary on the first round of the Women’s Open at Walton Heath, Surrey.
articles.title: Listen: Women's Open - first round

articles.description: BBC Sport looks back at some of Erling Haaland's best goals from his record-breaking first Premier League season as the champions prepare to launch their 2023-24 campaign at Burnley.
articles.title: Will Haaland do it again? Watch his best goals of 2022-23

articles.description: The insider tips on why some clubs 'win the window' by negotiating swift, good-value transfer deals and others don't.
articles.title: Open low, move fast, walk away - the art of the transfer deal

articles.description: England head coach Steve Borthwick names an experienced team for the World Cup warm-up match against Wales at Twickenham.
articles.title: England recall Farrell and Vunipola to face Wales

articles.description: Bethany England says she isn't "just happy to be here" and wants to win a place in England's starting line-up at the Women's World Cup.
articles.title: Striker England 'not just happy to be at World Cup'

articles.description: Watch as Kansas City Royals' Kyle Isbel breaks a light at Fenway Park, leaving Boston Red Sox's Masataka Yoshida confused about where the ball is.
articles.title: 'Bizarre!' Fielder baffled after batter hits ball into light
